title: Model Elyse Knowles demonstrates how she uses a skateboard as part of her workout sessions
text:
She regularly shows off her taut physique and washboard abs in bikini-clad snaps.

And on Friday, Elyse Knowles reveled that she as an usual tool for her workout sessions.

The 27-year-old too to Instagram to demonstrate how she incorporates a skateboard into her stretching and aerobic routine.

'Favourite toy for a summer bod!' Model Elyse Knowles (pictured) demonstrated how she uses a skateboard as part of her unusual workout sessions in an Instagram video posted on Friday

In a series of videos and photos, the model showed fans how they can use the board to lean against while doing leg extensions.

She also used the board for push-ups, and held onto it while doing star jumps before diving down onto her arms, still holding the board.

Elyse wrote in the caption: 'Summer favourite toy, for a summer bod bod. Link in website to see more of the workout and my hints and tricks to feel your best'.

Push it real good! She also used the board for push-ups, and held onto it while doing star jumps before diving down onto her arms, still holding the board

It comes after, in an interview with OK! Magazine, Elyse revealed she maintains her also enviable body by working out, eating healthy and limiting alcohol and caffeine.

The Myer Ambassador admits she's never tried coffee and isn't a fan of drinking.

She told the magazine: 'I don't actually enjoy drinking alcohol for its taste, but it also affects my tummy.'

The self-confessed gym junkie said she often starts her day with strength training and cardio, and enjoys a chai latte (which has zero caffeine).

Elyse wrote in the caption: 'Summer favourite toy, for a summer bod bod. Link in website to see more of the workout and my hints and tricks to feel your best'

Looking good! The workout clearly does wonders for the taut and muscular beauty

She also told the publication that before a fashion shoot she cuts out sugar from her diet and eats 'a lot of veggies, fish and actual fats like avocado, nuts and seeds'.

However, it's not the first time Elyse has spoken about her decision to avoid caffeine.

In March 2017, she told Husskie: 'It kills me when people think that it’s a necessity to drink coffee every morning, or have a Friday night bev after work. No one needs these things, you merely want them!'
